theme: Decentralization,Rural services and infrastructure,Indigenous peoples,Gender,Education for all

abstracts.cdata!:
Guatemala has one of the highest
            illiteracy rates and one of the lowest school enrollment
            rates in Latin America. The World Bank has been involved in
            the education sector in Guatemala for more than a decade. It
            has supported efforts to increase the number of children in
            primary schools and improve the quality of education in
            rural areas, largely through the national community-managed
            program for educational development (PRONADE) program of
            community-led schools and multi-grade, bilingual, and
            intercultural education. A follow-up project is currently
            being prepared to support needed expansion in lower
            secondary education, to assist Guatemala in reaching the
            education for all goals of universal access and completion
            of at least nine basic grades.
